intro: Soyeria pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. Soyeria pyrenaica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of alpine habitats.
